name: Eki
desc: Made a fun little stamping app for CalHacks 2024.
quote: Explore the world through the collection of virtual sticker and stamps, with the vast knowledge of the internet by your side.

name: Qura
desc: Developed a medication analyzer/detailer app to bring healthcare literacy, awareness, and informed decision making to patients for Ignition Hacks 2024.
quote: Mobile application that leverages the power of LLMs and the OpenFDA API to deliver accurate, personalized health information at your fingertips, instantly clearing up any medical doubts.

name: Meetomate
desc: A mobile application that helps people schedule in-person meetups through everyday activities to build real interactions. Developed the MVP during the term of my internship.

name: CryoLog
desc: Created a grocery scanner that doubles as a dietary coach, recommender, and nutrition summarizer based upon recent eating habits for Streamlit/Snowflake's Hackathon 2024.
quote: Revolutionize grocery shopping with personalized lists and dietary advice, streamlining the shopping process and enhancing nutrition awareness.

name: Skim-it
desc: Wrote a web app for succinct and concise local/global news in the form of tldrs, in the reddit format for Hacktech 2024.
quote: News media app designed to overcome the barriers of short-attention span in social media use through promotion of "social-media-like" news posts using LLM integrated summary and title generation.

name: FeynMind
desc: Made an ML-based studying web app for any subject for my first hackathon, which won!
quote: Web application for a guided Feynman Technique process using LLM API integration for feedback and question generation.

name: Cal Poly Pomona Multiple UAVs for Search and Rescue
desc: Spent a gap quarter working with the Cal Poly UAV team working on radio connection.

name: DECaF
desc: Disciplines of Engineering Career Fair is an annual event that connects top engineering students with leading recruiters through networking opportunities, recruiting sessions, and resume feedback.

name: Engineering on the Green
desc: An annual event held in Fall and Winter quarter where students can network with the various engineering orgs on campus.
